description: No neutron code coverage for v3 security groups
title: No neutron code coverage for v3 security groups

comments.content: No neutron code coverage for v3 security groups
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~arosen

comments.content: Just for context later, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34825/ for background here.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Means there wasn't test coverage for the v3 API change I believe, based on my old review comments:

Matt Riedemann		Sep 25, 2013
Patch Set 10:
Why wasn't the v3 code coverage added in this patch rather than opening new bug 1229520 to track it which may or may not make havana (rc1 is scheduled for tomorrow I believe).
I'm assuming the reason is time, or lack thereof, but I'm not sure if that is a good reason to not have test coverage for the code change in this patch.

Matt Riedemann		Sep 25, 2013
Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve
Mulled this over a bit, the v3 API is experimental in Havana and I think this is a bug we want fixed, so given you have a bug opened to track the v3 security group test exposure for neutron in nova, we can follow up using that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Matt Riedemann		Sep 19, 2013
Patch Set 8:
I know there are v3 tests similar to the v2 tests, is there nothing in the v3 tests for security groups? Regardless, there needs to be a test to cover the v3 API change also.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem
